content: Due to overwhelming demand to have a way to communicate with coffee machines via FHIR, the Hot Beverage FHIR IG is live. This IG implements RFC 2324 to give full morning pleasure to FHIR users and implementers alike. And, thanks to @John Moehrke it has full auditing so no worries about unauthorized coffee drinking will slip by. This desperately needed FHIR IG can be found at https://build.fhir.org/ig/DavidPyke/HotBeverage/ We will be looking to move it to HL7 and normative stats as soon as we get a good cup of espresso

That's a good question. We should bring this to the appropriate workgroup for detailed investigation. We may need a DAM to really determine the answer

and a query to check status Get /Espresson?identifier=mycoffeeorder
we initially did have a FHIR Resource... but doing this as an IG was more ... easy.
Key is that FHIR is used to heat the hot beverage

I have put together the first draft of a Questionnaire. Maybe we can discuss on the first call of this IG (there are going to be calls, right?)

I accept PRs, will merge after coffee :-D

This is splendid and I'm really glad to see that it was developed using FHIR Shorthand. As one of the creators and developers of FSH and SUSHI, I will claim that I had some part in helping to make this Hot Beverage FHIR IG a reality. I feel that I have now reached the pinnacle of my career and I look forward to the day when my grandchildren ask me to tell them that story about FHIR Shorthand and its role in the birth of the Hot Beverage IG. Thank you, @David Pyke and @John Moehrke for reminding us all why we're doing this very important work.
